newsitem.title: USA: Carolco files plan of reorganization.
newsitem.headline: Carolco files plan of reorganization.

text.p: Carolco Pictures Inc said it filed a joint plan of reorganization under Chapter 11 of the bankruptcy code.
The plan was filed jointly with certain units and the committee of creditors holding unsecured claims of Carolco.
Carolco and its units filed Chapter 11 bankruptcy petitions in November 1995 and have since sold many assets.
Until the plan takes effect, Carolco will continue to sell assets in accordance with the bankruptcy court procedures.
The proposed plan provides for creation of a trust to liquidate Carolco's remaining assets.
The trust will also prosecute claims and make distributions to creditors.
Under the plan, all equity securities of Carolco, will be cancelled and holders of such securities will not be entitled to receive any distributions.
The plan also contemplates a merger of The Vista Organization, LP, Carolco said. Carolco owns about 96 percent of the limited partnership interest with a subsidiary.
Under the plan, minority limited partners of Vista will be entitled to distributions from the liquidating trust.
The final plan of reorganization will be subject to acceptance by various classes of creditors and confirmation by the Bankruptcy Court, it said.
